body.p:
Lexington Ky Aug 19th 1865
Your Excellency
Governor Bramlette

We undersigned Citizens of Lexington bag leave to petition Your Excellency in behalf of Salomon Spiegel a Soldier of the 9th Mich. Vol. Cav. Said Spiegel has been charged and found guilty by the Fayette County Judge for peddling without license.

Being a Soldier he violated the laws as above Stated ingorantly and would not have done so, had he known, that he was doing wrong. He was fined for $300 and costs, of which he has paid the Portion, which is costs ^($156)^ In view of the above facts, we hope that you will see into his case, a proper one for the exercise of executive clemency and that you will remit his said funds

We are Your Excellency's
Very obedient Servants
St. Geo. T. Peckham
N. R. Forster.
Capt and A. A. A. C. 1" Div, D, K,
J M Williams Capt 49"
